title.rendered: “IDF and Shin Bet Arrest 31 Suspects, Including Hamas Affiliates, Across Judea and Samaria: An In-Depth Report”

content.rendered:
IDF spokesperson:

IDF soldiers, the Shin Bet, and the Border Police arrested 31 suspects last night throughout Judea and Samaria, ten of whom are affiliated with the Hamas terrorist organization.

IDF soldiers, the Shin Bet, and the Border Police operated last night to arrest 31 suspects throughout Judea and Samaria.

In Hebron, soldiers from the Judea Brigade arrested five suspects associated with the Hamas terrorist organization. In Beit Kahil and Yatta, the soldiers arrested four more suspects.

In the Nablus area of the Samaria brigade, the forces arrested three suspects and confiscated a gun. In Tel, within the brigade’s jurisdiction, the forces seized incitement materials.

In the Etzion Brigade, the soldiers arrested 11 suspects, including a suspect associated with the Hamas terror organization who incited to commit terrorist acts.

Two suspects were arrested in Kabatiya in Menashe, and two more suspects were arrested in Ein Umm Ashrait in Binyamin.

In the Qalqilya area of ​​the Ephraim Brigade, the soldiers arrested four suspects. During the night, the forces secured the entrance of worshippers to the tomb of Joshua Ben Nun.

The arrested suspects and the seized weapons were transferred for further handling by the security forces, with no injuries to our forces.

So far, since the start of the war, about 4,000 suspects have been arrested throughout the Judea and Samaria Division and in the Jordan Valley and the valleys, about 1,700 of them are affiliated with the Hamas terrorist organization.

Attached is documentation of the forces’ activities throughout Judea and Samaria: https://bit.ly/3wDkJD0

Attached are photos of the forces’ activities throughout Judea and Samaria: https://IDFANC.activetrail.biz/ANC090520246487698764974694
